meanings.definition: To crouch or huddle up closely
meanings.sent1: The cat was scrooching in the corner of the room.
meanings.sent2: I saw a mouse scrooching under the table.
meanings.sent3: The kids were scrooching together to fit in the small tent.
meanings.sent4: The flowers were scrooching towards the sunlight in the garden.
meanings.sent5: She scrooches down to pet the tiny puppy.

meanings.definition: To move or squeeze oneself into a small or restricted space
meanings.sent1: The squirrel was scrooching through the narrow gap in the fence.
meanings.sent2: I had to scrooch to get through the crowded hallway.
meanings.sent3: The clown was scrooching into the tiny car for the circus act.
meanings.sent4: The ants were scrooching into the tiny crack in the wall.
meanings.sent5: He scrooches into the packed subway train during rush hour.

meanings.definition: To hunch or huddle down closely
meanings.sent1: The old man was scrooching by the fireplace to keep warm.
meanings.sent2: The child scrooches closer to their mother during the scary movie.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was scrooching under the blanket for a nap.
meanings.sent4: The hedgehog scrooches into a ball when feeling threatened.
meanings.sent5: She scrooches down to listen to the secret conversation.
